page.title: 01THE MINSTERLEY AREA
page.content: The area is mostly farmland &forest.It has part of the Rea Valley with hills to the South.The River Rea joins the Severn in Shrewsbury. One main road runs through the bloc, the A488 from Bishops Castle to Shrewsbury. There are four small residential areas, the village of Minsterley,plus a corner of the much larger village of Pontesbury, & the hamlets of Plox Green & Habberley. Three factories are in or around Minsterley, one producing animal foods, another that processes meat, mostly ox tongue, & a large creamery.Many villagers have to travel to their work either to Shrewsbury, the nearest large town,or even beyond. Focal points for social life are the churches, pubs,& village hall.
